gurmukhi: < siqgur pRswid ]
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: 1 guxwN AvguxwN dI gqI
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: swier ivchu inklY kwlkUtu qY AMmiRq vwxI
transliteration: Saair Vichahu Nikalai Kaalakootu Tai Anmrit Vaanee.
translation: Deadly poison and nectar both were churned out of the ocean.

gurmukhi: auq KwDY mir mukIAY auq KwDY huie Amru prwxI
transliteration: Out Khaadhai Mari Moukeeai Outu Khaadhai Hoi Amaru Paraanee.
translation: Taking poison, one, dies whereas taking the other, (nectar) man becomes immortal.

gurmukhi: ivsu vsY muih sp dY grV dugwir AimA rs jwxI
transliteration: Visu Vasai Muhi Sap Dai Gararh Dougaari Amia Ras Jaanee.
translation: Poison resides in the mouth of snake and the jewel eructed by the blue jay (the eater of snakes) is known to be life-giving nectar.

gurmukhi: kwau n BwvY boilAw koiel bolI sBnwN BwxI
transliteration: Kaau N Bhaavai Boliaa Koil Bolee Sabhanaan Bhaanee.
translation: Crowing of the crow is disliked but the sound of nightingale is loved by all.

gurmukhi: burbolw n suKwveI imT bolw jig imqu ivfwxI
transliteration: Burabolaa N Soukhaavaee Mitd Bolaa Jagi Mitu Vidaanee.
translation: Evil speaker is not liked but the sweet tongued is praised all over the world.

gurmukhi: burw Blw sYswr ivic praupkwr ivkwr inswxI
transliteration: Buraa Bhalaa Saisaar Vichi Paraoupakaar Vikaar Nisaanee.
translation: Evil and good persons live in the same world but they are distinguished by their qualities of benevolent and perverted actions.

gurmukhi: gux Avgux giq AwiK vKwxI ]1]
transliteration: Goun Avagoun Gati Aakhi Vakhaanee ?1?
translation: We have here exposed the position of merits and demerits.

gurmukhi: 2 KojI Aqy vwdI
translation: Researcher and the disputant

gurmukhi: suJhu suJin iqin loA AMnHy GuGU suJu n suJY
transliteration: Sujhahu Sujhani Tini Loa Annhay Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhai.
translation: With sun's light all the three worlds are visible but the blind and the owl can not see the sun.

gurmukhi: ckvI sUrj hyqu hY kMqu imlY ivrqMqu su buJY
transliteration: Chakavee Sooraj Haytu Hai Kantu Milai Viratantu Su Bujhai.
translation: The female ruddy sheldrake loves the sun, and meeting the beloved they tell and listen to the love story of each other.

gurmukhi: rwiq AnHyrw pMKIAwN ckvI icqu AnHyir n ruJY
transliteration: Raati Anhayraa Pankheeaan Chakavee Chitu Anhayri N Rujhai.
translation: For all other birds the night is dark (and they sleep) but ruddy sheldrake's mind has no rest in that darkness (its mind is ever attued to sun).

gurmukhi: ibMb AMdir pRiqibMbu dyiK Brqw jwix sujwix smuJY
transliteration: Binb Andari Pratibinbu Daykhi Bharataa Jaani Sujaani Samujhai.
translation: An intellegent woman recognises her husband even by seeing his shadow in water,

gurmukhi: dyiK pCwvw pvy KUih fuib mrY sIhu loien luJY
transliteration: Daykhi Pachhaavaa Pavay Khoohi Doubi Marai Seehu Loin Lujhai.
translation: But the foolish lion, seeing its own shadow in the well jumps in it and dies and then blames its own eyes.

gurmukhi: KojI KojY Koju lY vwdI vwdu kryNdV KuJY
transliteration: Khojee Khojai Khoju Lai Vaadee Vaadu Karayndarh Khujhai.
translation: The researcher discovers the import of the above description but the disputant is led astray

gurmukhi: gors gweIN hsiqn duJY ]2]
transliteration: Gorasu Gaaeen Hasatini Dujhai ?2?
translation: And expects to get cow-milk from a female elephant (which in fact is impossible).

gurmukhi: 3 bgl smwDI
translation: Wicked persons remain unhappy even in happiness

gurmukhi: swvx vx hrIAwvly vuTy sukY Aku jvwhw
transliteration: Saavan Van Hareeaavalay Voutday Soukai Aku Javaahaa.
translation: In the month of Sayan forests go green but akk, a wild plant of sandy region, and /avail, the camel thorn, wither.

gurmukhi: cyiq vxspiq maulIAY Apq krIr n krY auswhw
transliteration: Chayti Vanasapati Mauleeai Apat Kareer N Karai Ousaahaa.
translation: In the month of Chaitr, the vegetation blooms but leafless kart (a wild caper) remains totally uninspired.

gurmukhi: suPl PlMdy ibrK sB isMmlu APlu rhY Aivswhw
transliteration: Suphal Phaladay Birakh Sabh Sinmalu Aphalu Rahai Avisaahaa.
translation: All the trees become full of fruits but the silk cotton tree remains devoid of fruit.

gurmukhi: cMnx vwsu vxwspiq vwNs invwis n auBy swhw
transliteration: Channan Vaasu Vanaasapati Vaans Nivaasi N Oubhay Saahaa.
translation: The whole vegetation is made fragrant by sandal wood but bamboo gets no impact of it and goes on sobbing and sighing.

gurmukhi: sMKu smuMdhu sKxw duiKAwrw rovY dy DwhwN
transliteration: Sankhu Samoundahu Sakhanaa Doukhiaaraa Rovai Day Dhaahaa.
translation: Even being in the ocean, the conch remains empty and cries bitterly when blown.

gurmukhi: bgul smwDI gMg ivic JIgY cuix cuix Kwie iBCwhw
transliteration: Bagul Samaadhee Gang Vichi Jheegai Chouni Chouni Khaai Bhichhaahaa.
translation: The crane even looking to be meditating upon the banks of Ganges, like a beggar picks up the fish and eats them up.

gurmukhi: swQ ivCuMny imldw Pwhw ]3]
transliteration: Saad Vichhounnay Miladaa Dhaahaa ?3?
translation: Separation from good company brings noose for the individual.

gurmukhi: 4 Blw burw
translation: Good and bad

gurmukhi: Awip Blw sBu jgu Blw Blw Blw sBnw kir dyKY
transliteration: Aapi Bhalaa Sabhu Jagu Bhalaa Bhalaa Bhalaa Sabhanaa Kari Daykhai.
translation: One's good mind finds everybody good in the world. A gentleman beholds everyone as gentle.

gurmukhi: Awip burw sBu jgu burw sB ko burw bury dy lyKY
transliteration: Aapi Buraa Sabhu Jagu Buraa Sabh Ko Buraa Buray Day Laykhai.
translation: If one is bad himself, for him the whole world is bad and all is bad on his account. Lord Krsna helped

gurmukhi: iksnu shweI pwNfvwN Bwie Bgiq krqUiq ivsyKY
transliteration: Kisanu Sahaaee Paandavaa Bhaai Bhagati Karatooti Visaykhai.
translation: Pindays because they had in them profuse sense of devotion and morality.

gurmukhi: vYr Bwau iciq kYrvwN gxqI gxin AMdir kwlyKY
transliteration: Vair Bhaau Chiti Kairavaan Ganatee Ganani Andari Kaalaykhai.
translation: Kaurays had enmity in their heart and they always calculated the dark side of things.

gurmukhi: Blw burw prvMinAw Bwlx gey n idsit sryKY
transliteration: Bhalaa Buraa Paravanniaa Bhaalan Gaay N Disati Saraykhai.
translation: Two princes went out to find a good and a wicked person but their views were different.

gurmukhi: burw nw koeI juiDstrY durjoDn ko Blw n ByKY
transliteration: Buraa N Koee Judhisatarai Durajodhan Ko Bhalaa N Bhaykhai.
translation: None was bad for Yudhisthar and Duryodhan did not find any good person.

gurmukhi: krvY hoie su totI ryKY ]4]
transliteration: Karavai Hoi Su Totee Raykhai ?4?
translation: Whatever (sweet or bitter) is there in the pot is known when it comes out through the spout.

gurmukhi: 5 Drmrwj dI pRisD kQw
translation: Famous tale of Dharmaraj

gurmukhi: sUrju Gir Avqwru lY Drm vIcwrix jwie bihTw
transliteration: Sooraju Ghari Avataaru Lai Dharam Veechaarani Jaai Bahitdaa.
translation: Born in the family of Sun, he (Dharrnaraj) adorned the seat of the dispenser of justice.

gurmukhi: mUriq iekw nwau duie Drmrwie jm dyiK sirTw
transliteration: Moorati Ikaa Naau Dui Dharam Raai Jam Daykhi Saritdaa.
translation: He is one but the creation knows him by two names-Dharmaraj and Yama.

gurmukhi: DrmI ifTw Drmrwie pwpu kmwie pwpI jm ifTw
transliteration: Dharamee Ditdaa Dharam Raai Paapu Kamaai Paapee Jam Ditdaa.
translation: People see him pious and righteous in the form of Dharmaraj but the wicked sinner as Yama.

gurmukhi: pwpI no pCVwieMdw DrmI nwil bulyNdw imTw
transliteration: Paapee No Pachharhaaindaa Dharamee Naali Bulayndaa Mitdaa.
translation: He also thrashes the evil doer but speks sweetly to the religious person.

gurmukhi: vYrI dyKin vYr Bwie imqR Bwie kir dyKin ieTw
transliteration: Vairee Daykhani Vair Bhaai Mitr Bhaai Kari Daykhani Itdaa.
translation: Enemy sees him with enmity and the friendly people know him as loving one.

gurmukhi: nrk surg ivic puMn pwp vr srwp jwxin ABirTw
transliteration: Narak Surag Vichi Pounn Paap Var Saraap Jaanani Abharitdaa.
translation: Sin and merit, boon and curse, heaven and hell are known and realised according to one's own feelings (of love and enmity).

gurmukhi: drpix rUp ijvyhI ipTw ]5]
transliteration: Darapani Roop Jivayhee Pitdaa ?5?
translation: Mirror reflects the shadow according to the object before it.

gurmukhi: 6 su`D AwrsI
translation: Clean mirror

gurmukhi: ijauN kir inrml AwrsI sBw suD sB koeI dyKY
transliteration: Jioun Kari Niramal Aarasee Sabhaa Sudh Sabh Koee Daykhai.
translation: In the clean mirror everybody sees his correct shape.

gurmukhi: gorw gory idsdw kwlw kwly vMnu ivsyKY
transliteration: Goraa Goray Disadaa Kaalaa Kaalo Vannu Visaykhai.
translation: Fair complexion is reflected fair and black one specifically black in it.

gurmukhi: his his dyKY hsq muK roNdw rovxhwru sulyKY
transliteration: Hasi Hasi Daykhai Hasat Moukh Rondaa Rovanahaaru Sulaykhai.
translation: A laughing person finds his face laughing and weeping one as weeping in it.

gurmukhi: lypu n lgY AwrsI iCA drsnu idsin bhu ByKY
transliteration: Laypu N Lagai Aarasee Chhia Darasanu Disani Bahu Bhaykhai.
translation: The followers of six philosophies wearing different guises see in it, but the mirror remains detached to them all.

gurmukhi: durmiq dUjw Bwau hY vYru ivroDu kroD kulyKY
transliteration: Duramati Doojaa Bhaau Hai Vairu Virodhu Karodhu Kulaykhai.
translation: Sense of duality is the evil intellect which is the another name of enmity, opposition and anger.

gurmukhi: gurmiq inrmlu inrmlw smdrsI smdrs sryKY
transliteration: Guramati Niramalu Niramalaa Samadarasee Samadaras Saraykhai.
translation: Pious followers of the wisdom of Guru always remain pure and egalitarian.

gurmukhi: Blw burw huie rUp n ryKY ]6]
transliteration: Bhalaa Buraa Hui Roopu N Raykhai ?6?
translation: Otherwise, there is no other distinction of the good and the bad person.

gurmukhi: 7 gurU pwhrU
translation: Guru, the caretaker guard

gurmukhi: iekqu sUrij AwQvY rwiq AnyrI cmkin qwry
transliteration: Ikatu Sooraji Aadavai Raati Anayree Chamakani Taaray.
translation: Once the son sets in the evening stars twinkle in the dark night.

gurmukhi: swh svin Gir AwpxY cor iPrix Gir musxYhwry
transliteration: Saah Savani Ghari Aapanai Chor Dhirani Ghari Muhanaihaaray.
translation: Rich people sleep in their homes but the thieves move around to commit thefts.

gurmukhi: jwgin ivrly pwhrU rUAwiein husIAwr ibdwry
transliteration: Jaagani Viralay Paaharoo Rooaaini Houseeaar Bidaaray.
translation: A few guards remain awake and go on shouting to alert others.

gurmukhi: jwig jgwiein suiqAw swh PVMdy cor cgwry
transliteration: Jaagi Jagaaini Soutiaan Saah Dharhanday Chor Chagaaray.
translation: Those awakened watchmen make sleeping people awake and this way they catch hold of thiefs and vagabonds.

gurmukhi: jwgidAw Gru riKAw suqy Gr musin vycwry
transliteration: Jaagadiaan Gharu Rakhiaa Soutay Ghar Mousani Vaychaaray.
translation: Those who remain awake protect their homes but the house is looted of those who go on sleeping.

gurmukhi: swh Awey Gir AwpxY cor jwir lY grdin mwrY
transliteration: Saah Aaay Ghari Aapanai Chor Jaari Lai Garadani Maaray.
translation: The rich men handing over the thieves (to the authorities), happily return home but caught from their necks the thieves are beaten hollow.

gurmukhi: Bly bury vrqin sYswry ]7]
transliteration: Bhalay Buray Varatani Saisaaray ?7?
translation: The evil and the meritorious both are active in this world.

gurmukhi: 8 sMg suBwau
translation: Nature of the company

gurmukhi: mauly AMb bsMq ruiq AauVI Aku su PulI BirAw
transliteration: Maulay Anb Basant Routi Aurhee Aku Su Phulee Bhariaa.
translation: In spring season, the mangoes blossom and akk the bitter wild plant of sandy region also becomes full of flowers.

gurmukhi: AMib n lgY KKVI Aik n lgY AMbu APirAw
transliteration: Anbi N Lagai Khakharhee Aki N Lagai Anbu Adhariaa.
translation: The pod of akk cannot produce mango and fruitless akk cannot grow on mango tree.

gurmukhi: kwlI koiel AMb vix Aikiqfu icqu imqwlw hirAw
transliteration: Kaalee Koil Anb Vani Akitidu Chitu Mitaalaa Hariaa.
translation: Nightingale sitting on mango tree is black and the grosshopper of akk is speckled one or green.

gurmukhi: mn pMKyrU ibrK Bydu sMg suBwau soeI Plu DirAw
transliteration: Man Pankhayroo Birad Bhaydu Sang Soubhaau Soee Phalu Dhariaa.
translation: Mind is a bird and due to difference of the results of different company, it gets the fruit of the tree it chooses to sit upon.

gurmukhi: gurmiq frdw swDsMig durmiq sMig AswD n firAw
transliteration: Guramati Daradaa Saadhasangi Duramati Sangi Asaadh N Dariaa.
translation: Mind is scared of holy congregation and the wisdom of the Guru but is not afraid of evil company and evil intellect i.e. it does not want to go in good company and takes interest in the evil company.

gurmukhi: Bgiq vClu BI AwKIAY piqq auDwrix piqq auDirAw
transliteration: Bhagati Vachhalu Bhee Aakheeai Patit Udhaarani Patit Udhariaa.
translation: God is said to be loving towards saints and liberator of the fallen ones.

gurmukhi: jo iqsu Bwxw soeI qirAw ]8]
transliteration: Jo Tisu Bhaanaa Soee Tariaa ?8?
translation: He has salvaged many fallen pepole and only he gets across who is accepted by Him.

gurmukhi: 9 pUqnw
translation: Mani

gurmukhi: jykir auDrI pUqnw ivhu pIAwlxu kMmu n cMgw
transliteration: Jay Kari Udharee Pootanaa Vihu Peeaalanu Kanmu N Changaa.
translation: If even Pfitana (female demon) got liberated that does not mean that poisoning some one is a good act.

gurmukhi: ginkw auDrI AwKIAY pr Gir jwie n leIAY pMgw
transliteration: Ganikaa Udharee Aakheeai Par Ghari Jaai N Laeeai Pangaa.
translation: Gariika (a prostitute) was liberated but one should not enter other's house and invite trouble.

gurmukhi: bwlmIku insqwirAw mwrY vwt n hoie insMgw
transliteration: Baalameeku Nisataariaa Maarai Vaat N Hoi Nisangaa.
translation: Since Valmlici got blest, one should not adopt the way of highway robbery.

gurmukhi: PMiDk auDrY AwKIAin PwhI pwie n PVIAY tMgw
transliteration: Dhandhaki Udharai Aakheeani Dhaahee Paai N Dharheeai Tangaa.
translation: One bird catcher is also said to be liberated, but we should not catch hold of the leg of others by using snares.

gurmukhi: jy kwsweI auDirAw jIAw Gwie n KweIAY BMgw
transliteration: Jay Kaasaaee Udhariaa Jeeaa Ghaai N Khaaeeai Bhangaa.
translation: If Sadhana, the butcher got across (the world ocean), we should not put ourselves to harm by killing others.

gurmukhi: pwir auqwrY boihQw suienw lohu nwhI iek rMgw
transliteration: Paari Outaarai Bohidaa Suinaa Lohu Naahee Ik Rangaa.
translation: Ship takes across both iron and gold but still their forms and colours are not the same.

gurmukhi: iequ BrvwsY rhxu kuFMgw ]9]
transliteration: Itu Bharavaasai Rahanu Kuddhangaa ?9?
translation: In fact, living on such hopes is a bad life style.

gurmukhi: 10 pwp dI rIs burI hY
translation: It is always bad to imitate evil

gurmukhi: pY KwjUrI jIvIAY cViH KwjUrI JVau n koeI
transliteration: Pai Khaajooree Jeeveeai Charhhi Khaajooree Jharhau N Koee.
translation: Surviving the fall from the palm tree does not mean that one should climb the tree to fall from it.

gurmukhi: auJiV pieAw n mwrIAY auJV rwhu n cMgw hoeI
transliteration: Ujharhi Paiaa N Maareeai Ujharh Raahu N Changaa Hoee.
translation: Even if one is not killed in desolete places and ways, moving on deserted places is not safe.

gurmukhi: jy sp KwDw aubry spu n PVIAY AMiq ivgoeI
transliteration: Jay Sap Khaadhaa Oubaray Sapu N Dharheeai Anti Vigoee.
translation: One may survive even when bitten by a sanke even then catching the sanke will be harmful ultimately.

gurmukhi: vhix vhMdw inklY ivxu qulhy fuib mrY BloeI
transliteration: Vahani Vahandaa Nikalai Vinu Tulahay Doubi Marai Bhaloee.
translation: Getting washed away by the current of river if someone comes out of it alone, even then in entering the river without a raft there is more possibility of drowning.

gurmukhi: piqq auDwrxu AwKIAY ivrqIhwxu jwxu jwxoeI
transliteration: Patit Udhaaranu Aakheeai Virateehaanu Jaanu Jaanoee.
translation: People of all inclinations know very well that God is liberator of the fallen ones.

gurmukhi: BwauBgiq gurmiq hY durmiq drgh lhY n FoeI
transliteration: Bhaau Bhagati Guramati Hai Duramati Daragah Lahai N Ddhoee.
translation: Precept of the Guru (Gurmat) is the loving devotion and the people having evil intellect do not get shelter in the court of the Lord.

gurmukhi: AMiq kmwxw hoie sQoeI ]10]
transliteration: Anti Kamaanaa Hoi Sadoee ?10?
translation: The deeds done in life are the only companions in the end.

gurmukhi: 11 gurmuK mnmuK dw Prk guxw krky
translation: Different qualities of Gurmukh and Manmukh

gurmukhi: Qom kQUrI vwsu ijau kMcnu lohu nhIN iek vMnw
transliteration: Dom Kadooree Vaasu Jioun Kanchanu Lohu Naheen Ik Vannaa.
translation: As the smell of the garlic and musk is different, the gold and iron are also not the same.

gurmukhi: Ptk n hIry quil hY smsir nVI n vVIAY gMnw
transliteration: Dhatak N Heeray Tuli Hai Samasari Narhee N Varheeai Gannaa.
translation: Glass crystal is not equal to diamond and likewise, the sugarcane and a hollow reed are not the same.

gurmukhi: quil n rqnw rqkw muil n kcu ivkwvY pMnw
transliteration: Tuli N Ratanaa Ratakaan Muli N Kachu Vikaavai Pannaa.
translation: Red and black seed (rata) is not equal to jewel and glass cannot sell at the price of emerald.

gurmukhi: durmiq GuMmx vwxIAY gurmiq sukiRqu boihQu bMnwN
transliteration: Duramati Ghounman Vaaneeai Guramati Soukritu Bohidu Bannaa.
translation: Evil intellect is a whirlpool but the wisdom of Guru (gurmat) is the ship of good deeds that takes across.

gurmukhi: inMdw hovy bury dI jY jY kwr Bly DMnu DMnw
transliteration: Nidaa Hovai Buray Dee Jai Jai Kaar Bhalay Dhannu Dhannaa.
translation: Evil person is always condemned and the good person is applauded by all.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK prgtu jwxIAY mnmuK scu rhY prCMnw
transliteration: Guramoukhi Paragatu Jaaneeai Manamoukh Sachu Rahai Parachhannaa.
translation: Through the gurmukhs, the truth becomes manifest and thus is known by one and all, but in the manmukhs, the same truth is pressed and concealed.

gurmukhi: kMim n AwvY BwNfw BMnw ]11]
transliteration: Kanmi N Aavai Bhaandaa Bhannaa ?11?
translation: Like a broken pot, it is of no use.

gurmukhi: 12 auho hI, krnI krky
translation: Fame and disrepute according to the actions ,

gurmukhi: iek vycin hQIAwr GiV iek svwrin islw sMjoAw
transliteration: Ik Vaychani Hadeeaar Gharhi Ik Savaarani Silaa Sanjoaa.
translation: Many a man prepare arms and sell them out and many cleanse armours.

gurmukhi: rx ivic Gwau bcwau kir duie dl iniq auiT krdy FoAw
transliteration: Ran Vichi Ghaau Bachaau Kari Dui Dal Niti Outdi Karaday Ddhoaa.
translation: In the batle the arms inflict wounds and armours protect as the warriors of both the armies clash time and again.

gurmukhi: Gwielu hoie nMgwsxw bKqr vwlw nvwN inroAw
transliteration: Ghaailu Hoi Nagaasanaa Bakhatar Vaalaa Navaan Niroaa.
translation: Those uncovered are wounded but those who have worn the armour remain well and intact.

gurmukhi: krin gumwnu kmwngr KwnjrwdI bhuqu bKoAw
transliteration: Karani Goumaanu Kamaanagar Khaanajaraadee Bahoutu Bakhoaa.
translation: Bow makers also feel proud of their special bows.

gurmukhi: jg ivic swD AswD sMgu sMg suBwie jwie Plu BoAw
transliteration: Jag Vichi Saadh Asaadh Sangu Sang Soubhaai Jaai Phalu Bhoaa.
translation: Two types of associations, one of the sadhus and the other of the wicked ones are there in this world and meeting them different results are produced.

gurmukhi: krm su Drm ADrm kir suK duK AMdir Awie proAw
transliteration: Karam Su Dharam Adharam Kari Soukh Doukh Andari Aai Paroaa.
translation: That is why, the individual because of his good and bad conduct remains absorbed in his pleasures or sufferings.

gurmukhi: Bly bury jsu Apjsu hoAw ]12]
transliteration: Bhalay Buray Jasu Apajasu Hoaa ?12?
translation: The good and bad receive fame and infamy respectively.

gurmukhi: 13 auho hI
translation: Fame and disrepute according to the actions

gurmukhi: squ sMqoKu dieAw Drmu ArQ sugrQu swDsMig AwvY
transliteration: Sat Santokhu Daiaa Dharamu Arad Sougaradu Saadhasangi Aavai.
translation: Truth, contentment, compassion, dharma, wealth, and other best things are attained in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: kwmu kroDu AswD sMig loBu mohu AhMkwr mcwvY
transliteration: Kaamu Karodhu Asaadh Sangi Lobhi Mohu Ahankaar Machaavai.
translation: Association with the wicked increases lust, anger, greed, infatuation and ego.

gurmukhi: dukiRqu sukiRqu krm kir burw Blw huie nwau DrwvY
transliteration: Doukritu Soukritu Karam Kari Buraa Bhalaa Hui Naaoun Dharaavai.
translation: A good or a bad name is earned on account of good or bad deeds respectively.

gurmukhi: gorsu gweI Kwie KVu ieku ieku jxdI vgu vDwvY
transliteration: Gorasu Gaaeen Khaai Kharhu Iku Iku Janadee Vagu Vadhaavai.
translation: Eating grass and oilcakes, the cow gives milk and giving birth to calves increases the herd.

gurmukhi: duiD pIqY ivhu dyie sp jix jix bhly bcy KwvY
transliteration: Dudhi Peetai Vihu Dayi Sap Jani Jani Bahalay Bachay Khaavai.
translation: Drinking milk, the snake vomits poison and eats up its Own progeny.

gurmukhi: sMg suBwau AswDu swDu pwpu puMnu duKu suKu Plu pwvY
transliteration: Sang Soubhaau Asaadh Saadhu Paapu Pounnu Doukhu Soukhu Phalu Paavai.
translation: The association with the sadhus and wickeds variously produces sin and meirit, sorrows and pleasures.

gurmukhi: praupkwr ivkwru kmwvY ]13]
transliteration: Paraoupakaar Vikaaru Kamaavai ?13?
translation: The fill, inculcates benevolence or evil propensities.

gurmukhi: 14 Blw burw
translation: Good and bad one

gurmukhi: cMnxu ibrKu subwsu dy cMnxu krdw ibrK sbwey
transliteration: Channanu Birakhu Soubaasu Day Channanu Karadaa Birakh Sabaaay.
translation: Giving fragrance to all trees, the sandalwood tree makes them fragrant.

gurmukhi: Khdy vwNshuN Aig DuiK Awip jlY prvwru jlwey
transliteration: Khahaday Vaansahu Agi Dhoukhi Aapi Jalai Paravaaru Jalaaay.
translation: By the friction of the bamboos (on the other hand) the bamboo itself gets burnt and burns the whole family (of bamboos).

gurmukhi: mulh ijvY pMKyrUAw PwsY Awip kutMb Phwey
transliteration: Mulah Jivai Pankhayrooaa Dhaasai Aapi Koutanb Dhahaaay.
translation: Twithering quail not only gets caught but also makes the whole family ensnared.

gurmukhi: Ast Dwqu huie prbqhu pwrsu kir kMcnu idKlwey
transliteration: Asat Dhaatu Hui Parabatahu Paarasu Kari Kanchanu Dikhalaaay.
translation: The eight metals found in the mountains are converted into gold by the philosopher's stone.

gurmukhi: gixkw vwVY jwie kY hovin rogI pwp kmwey
transliteration: Ganikaa Vaarhai Jaai Kai Hovani Rogee Paap Kamaaay.
translation: The people going to the prostitutes earn sins besides contagious diseases.

gurmukhi: duKIey Awvin vYd Gr dwrU dy dy rogu imtwey
transliteration: Doukheeay Aavani Vaid Ghar Daaroo Day Day Rogu Mitaaay.
translation: The sufferers from a disease come to the physician and he giving medicine cures them.

gurmukhi: Blw burw duie sMg suBwey ]14]
transliteration: Bhalaa Buraa Dui Sang Soubhaaay ?14?
translation: Because of the nature of the company kept, one becomes good or bad.

gurmukhi: 15 Blw burw
translation: Good and bad

gurmukhi: Blw suBwau mjIT dw shY Avtxu rMgu cVHwey
transliteration: Bhalaa Soubhaau Majeetd Daa Sahai Avatanu Rangu Charhhaaay.
translation: The nature of madder is gentle; it bears the heat but dyes others in fast colour.

gurmukhi: gMnw kolU pIVIAY ttir pieAw imTwsu vDwey
transliteration: Gannaa Koloo Peerheeai Tatari Paiaa Mitdaasu Vadhaaay.
translation: Sugarcane is first crushed in crusher and then put on fire in a cauldron where it further increases its sweetness when baking soda is put into it.

gurmukhi: quMmy AMmiRqu isMjIAY kauVqx dI bwix n jwey
transliteration: Tounmay Anmritu Sinjeeai Kaurhatan Dee Baani N Jaaay.
translation: Colocynth even if irrigated with nectar, does not shed its bitterness.

gurmukhi: Avgux kIqy gux krY Blw n Avgux iciq vswey
transliteration: Avagoun Keetay Goun Karai Bhalaa N Avaganu Chiti Vasaaay.
translation: A noble person does not adopt demerits in his heart and does good to the evil doer.

gurmukhi: guxu kIqy Aauguxu krY burw n mMn AMdir gux pwey
transliteration: Gounu Keetay Aougounu Karai Buraa N Mann Andari Goun Paaay.
translation: But the evil doer does not adopt virutues in his heart, and does evil to the benevolent.

gurmukhi: jo bIjY soeI Plu Kwey ]15]
transliteration: Jo Beejai Soee Phalu Khaaay ?15?
translation: One reaps what one sows.

gurmukhi: 16 Bly bury dI suBwvk nykI bdI
translation: Natural evil or goodness of the bad and the noble

gurmukhi: pwxI pQr lIk ijau Blw burw prikriq suBwey
transliteration: Paanee Padaru Leek Jioun Bhalaa Buraa Parakirati Soubhaaay.
translation: As is the case with water and stone, things are good or bad according to their nature.

gurmukhi: vYru n itkdw Bly iciq hyqu n itkY burY min Awey
transliteration: Vair N Tikadaa Bhalay Chiti Haytu N Tikai Burai Mani Aaay.
translation: A noble heart carries no enmity, and love does not abide in an evil heart.

gurmukhi: Blw n hyqu ivswrdw burw n vYru mnhu ivsrwey
transliteration: Bhalaa N Haytu Visaaradaa Buraa N Vairu Manahu Visaraaay.
translation: The noble one never forgets good done to him whereas the evil doer does not forget enmity.

gurmukhi: Aws n pujY duhw dI durmiq gurmiq AMiq lKwey
transliteration: Aas N Pujai Duhaan Dee Duramati Guramati Anti Lakhaaay.
translation: Both fmd in the end their desires unfulfilled because the evil still wants to commit evil and the noble wants to go on spreading benevolence.

gurmukhi: BilAhu burw n hovhI buirAhu Blw n Blw mnwey
transliteration: Bhaliahu Buraa N Hovaee Buriahoun Bhalaa N Bhalaa Manaaay.
translation: The noble cannot commit evil but the noble should not expect nobility in an evil person.

gurmukhi: ivrqIhwxu vKwixAw seI isAwxI isK suxwey
transliteration: Virateehaanu Vakhaaniaa Saee Siaanee Sikh Sounaaay.
translation: This is the essence of the wisdom of hundreds of people and accordingly I have explained the thoughts in vogue around.

gurmukhi: praupkwr ivkwr kmwey ]16]
transliteration: Paraoupakaar Vikaaru Kamaaay ?16?
translation: Benevolence may (at times) be repaid in the form of evil.

gurmukhi: 17 Bly bury dI khwxI
translation: The tale of the noble and bad one)

gurmukhi: ivrqIhwxu vKwixAw Bly bury dI suxI khwxI
transliteration: Virateehaanu Vakhaaniaa Bhalay Buray Dee Sounee Kahaanee.
translation: On the basis of the stories listened to, I have described the present state of affairs.

gurmukhi: Blw burw duie cly rwih aus QY qosw aus QY pwxI
transliteration: Bhalaa Buraa Dui Chalay Raahi Ous Dai Tosaa Ous Dai Paanee.
translation: A bad and a noble man went on a journey. The noble one had bread and the evil had water with him.

gurmukhi: qosw AgY riKAw Bly BlweI AMdir AwxI
transliteration: Tosaa Agai Rakhiaa Bhalay Bhalaaee Andari Aanee.
translation: Being noble-natured, the good person laid out bread to eat.

gurmukhi: burw burweI kir gieAw hQIN kiF n idqo pwxI
transliteration: Buraa Buraaee Kari Gaiaa Hadeen Kaddhi N Dito Paanee.
translation: The evil minded performed his wickedness (and ate up his bread) tut did not offer water to him.

gurmukhi: Blw BlweIAhu isiJAw bury burweIAhuM vYix ivhwxI
transliteration: Bhalaa Bhalaaeeahu Sijhiaa Buray Buraaeeahoun Vaini Vihaanee.
translation: The noble got the fruit of his nobility (and got liberated) but the evil person had to spend this night of life, weeping and wailing.

gurmukhi: scw swihbu inAwau scu jIAwN dw jwxoeI jwxI
transliteration: Sachaa Saahibu Niaau Sachu Jeeaan Daa Jaanoee Jaanee.
translation: That omnicient Lord is true and His justice is also true.

gurmukhi: kudriq kwdr no kurbwxI ]17]
transliteration: Kudarati Kaadar No Kurabaanee ?17?
translation: I am sacrifice unto the creator and His creation (because different are the natutes of the two children of the same Lord).

gurmukhi: 18 rwm Aqy rwvx
translation: Ram and Ravan

gurmukhi: Blw burw sYswr ivic jo AwieAw iqsu srpr mrxw
transliteration: Bhalaa Buraa Saisaar Vichi Jo Aaiaa Tisu Sarapar Maranaa.
translation: The evil and noble exist in this world and whosoever came here, has to die one day.

gurmukhi: rwvx qY rwmcMd vwNig mhwN blI liV kwrxu krxw
transliteration: Raavan Tai Raamachand Vaangi Mahaan Balee Larhi Kaaranu Karanaa.
translation: The brave persons like Ravan and Ram also became the cause and doers of wars.

gurmukhi: jru jrvwxw vis kir AMiq ADrm rwvix mn Drxw
transliteration: Jaru Jaravaanaa Vasi Kari Anti Adharam Raavani Man Dharanaa.
translation: Controlling the mighty age, i.e. conquering the time, Ravan adopted evil in his heart (and stole Sita).

gurmukhi: rwmcMdu inrmlu purKu Drmhu swier pQr qrxw
transliteration: Raamachandu Niramalu Purakhu Dharamahu Saair Padar Taranaa.
translation: Ram was a spotless person and due to his sense of dharma (responsibility), even the stones floated in ocean.

gurmukhi: buirAweIAhu rwvxu gieAw kwlk itkw pr qiRA hrxw
transliteration: Buriaaeeahu Raavanu Gaiaa Kaalaa Tikaa Par Tria Haranaa.
translation: On account of wickedness Ravan went away (was killed) with the stigma of stealing another's wife.

gurmukhi: rwmwiexu juig juig Atlu sy auDry jo Awey srxw
transliteration: Raamaainu Jougi Jougi Atalu Say Udharay Jo Aaay Saranaa.
translation: Ramayan (the story of Ram) is ever firm (in the mind of people) and whosoever seeks shelter (in it) goes across (the world ocean).

gurmukhi: js Apjs ivic infr frxw ]18]
transliteration: Jas Apajas Vichi Nidar Daranaa ?18?
translation: Dharma-abiding people earn glory in the world and those who undertake evil adventures get infamy.

gurmukhi: 19 rwvx dI jgq pRis`D kQw
translation: Famous tale of Ram and Ravan

gurmukhi: soien lMkw vfw gVu Kwr smuMd ijvyhI KweI
transliteration: Soin Lakaa Vadaa Garhu Khaar Samound Jivayhee Khaaee.
translation: Golden Lanka was a grand fort and the ocean around it was like a vast moat.

gurmukhi: lK puqu poqy svw lKu kuMBkrxu mihrwvxu BweI
transliteration: Lakh Poutu Potay Savaa Lakhu Kounbhakaranu Mahiraavanu Bhaaee.
translation: Ravan had one lac sons, one and a quarter lac grand sons and brothers like Kumbhkaran and Mahiravari.

gurmukhi: pvxu buhwrI dyie iniq ieMdR BrY pwxI vriHAweI
transliteration: Pavanu Buhaaree Dayi Niti Indr Bharai Paanee Varhiaaee.
translation: Air would broom his palaces whereas Indr through rains carried water for him.

gurmukhi: bYsMqur rwsoeIAw sUrju cMdu crwg dIpweI
transliteration: Baisantur Raasoeeaa Sooraju Chandu Charaag Deepaaee.
translation: Fire was his cook and the sun and the moon his lamp burners.

gurmukhi: bhu KUhix cqurMg dl dys n vys n kImiq pweI
transliteration: Bahu Khoohani Chaturang Dal Days N Vays N Keemati Paaee.
translation: His huge army of horses, elephants, chariots and infantry comprising many khuhants (akeauhauts, one aksauhani is known as a mixed force of 21870 elephants, 21870 chariots, 65610 horse and 109350 foot soldiers) was such whose power and grandeur cannot be e

gurmukhi: mhwdyv dI syv kir dyv dwnv rhdy srxweI
transliteration: Mahaadayv Dee Sayv Kari Dayv Daanav Rahanday Saranaaee.
translation: He (Ravan) had served Mahadev (Siva) and due to this all the gods and demons were under his shelter.

gurmukhi: Apjsu lY durmiq buirAweI ]19]
transliteration: Apajasu Lai Duramati Buriaaee ?19?
translation: But evil intellect and actions earned him infamy.

gurmukhi: 20 rwmcMd dI lok pRis`D kQw
translation: Famous story of Ramchandr

gurmukhi: rwmcMdu kwrx krx kwrx vis hoAw dyihDwrI
transliteration: Raamachandu Kaaran Karan Kaaran Vasi Hoaa Dayhidhaaree.
translation: Due to some reason, Lord, the cause of all the causes assumed the form of Ramchandr.

gurmukhi: mMin mqyeI AwigAw lY vxvwsu vfweI cwrI
transliteration: Manni Matayee Aagiaa Lai Vanavaasu Vadaaee Chaaree.
translation: Accepting the orders of his step mother he went in exile and earned greatness.

gurmukhi: prsrwmu dw blu hrY dIn dieAwlu grb prhwrI
transliteration: Parasaraamu Daa Balu Harai Deen Daiaalu Garab Parahaaree.
translation: Compassionate for the poor and decimator of the proud ones Ram effaced the power and pride of Pars'u Ram.

gurmukhi: sIqw lKmx syv kir jqI sqI syvw ihqkwrI
transliteration: Seetaa Lakhaman Sayv Kari Jatee Satee Sayvaa Hitakaaree.
translation: Serving Warn, Laksaman became yati, the subduer of all passions and Sits also with all the virtues of a sati, remained totally devoted to Ram and served him.

gurmukhi: rwmwiexu vrqwieAw rwm rwju kir siRsit auDwrI
transliteration: Raamaainu Varataaiaa Raam Raaju Kari Srisati Udhaaree.
translation: Ramayan spread far and wide as the story establishing Ram-Rajy, a virtuous kingdom.

gurmukhi: mrxu muxsw scu hY swDsMgiq imil pYj svwrI
transliteration: Maranu Mounasaa Sachu Hai Saadhasangati Mili Paij Savaaree.
translation: Ram had liberated the whole world. Death for them is a truth who, having come to the holy congregation, have fulfilled their commitment to life.

gurmukhi: BilAweI siqgur miq swrI ]20]31]
transliteration: Bhaliaaee Satigur Mati Saaree ?20?31?ikateeha?
translation: Benevolence is the perfect teaching of the Guru.

gurmukhi: qiRgun AqIq cqurQ gun gMimqw kY pMc qq aulMiG prm qq vwsI hY
transliteration: Trigoun Ateet Chaturad Goun Ganmitaa Kai , Panch Tat Ulanghi Param Tat Vaasee Hai ?
translation: detachinghimselffromtheworldlyattractionsandthethreeitsofmaya,aGuru-consciouspersonacquiresfourthstateanddiscardingalladorationsofthebodylivesinthememorytheLord.

gurmukhi: Kt rs iqAwig pRym rs kau pRwpiq Bey pUr suir spq Anhd AiBAwsI hY
transliteration: Khat Ras Tiaagi Praym Ras Kau Praapati Bhaay , Poor Suri Sapat Anahad Abhiaasee Hai ?
translation: Heisnotenamouredbythetastesofworldlythings,andenjoystheblissofloveoftheLord;andcelestialmusicbykeepingHiminhismindallthetime

gurmukhi: Ast isDwNq Byd nwQn kY nwQ Bey dsm sQl suK swgr iblwsI hY
transliteration: Asat Sidhaant Bhayd Naadan Kai Naad Bhaay , Dasam Sadal Soukh Saagar Bilaasee Hai ?
translation: herenunciatesyogandwaysofNathsandsurpassesthem;all-spiritually,andreachingtheultimate,enjoysallhappinessandpeace.
